snippet: Jonathan Vilma, a team captain, was suspended without pay for the coming season; Cleveland’s Scott Fujita, Green Bay’s Anthony Hargrove, and New Orleans’s Will Smith received lesser penalties.
abstract: NFL suspends New Orleans Saints defensive captain Jonathan Vilma without pay for the 2012 season for his role in the team's bounty scandal; three other former and current Saints receive lesser penalties. Photos (M)3
lead_paragraph: Jonathan Vilma, the New Orleans Saints' defensive captain, was suspended by the N.F.L. without pay for the 2012 season Wednesday. The league said he helped the former defensive coordinator Gregg Williams in ''establishing and funding'' the team's bounty program, which rocked the Saints this off-season and also led to the suspension of Coach Sean Payton. Vilma's suspension is the longest of those imposed on four players. Cleveland's Scott Fujita and Green Bay's Anthony Hargrove, both former Saints, and New Orleans's Will Smith received lesser penalties.

headline.main: N.F.L. Suspends Vilma and Three Other Players for Bounty Scheme
